abstract_ssm: Edward Carpenter was a British socialist writer and poet, known for his advocacy of natural living, and for his writings on homosexuality and his open espousal of this identity. The collection contains letters and postcards, and printed ephemera.
corpname_ssm: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
title_ssm: The Story of Eros and Psyche

unittitle_ssm: Lloyd, Bertram [aka E. Bertram, aka "Wolfie"]: Letters (to, from) Contents: - 1. B.L. [ALS] to E.C., undated, in German, on both sides of a sheet measuring 2.75" x 7.125" - 2. E.C to E.B.L., postcard, 26 Jan 1920, [ALS] - 3. E.C.[?] to "My Dear Wolfie" 2 Jan 1921, [ALS] - 4. E.C. to "Dear Wolfie," 1 Dec 1923 [copy by Lloyd]
heading_ssm: Lloyd, Bertram [aka E. Bertram, aka "Wolfie"]: Letters (to, from) Contents: - 1. B.L. [ALS] to E.C., undated, in German, on both sides of a sheet measuring 2.75" x 7.125" - 2. E.C to E.B.L., postcard, 26 Jan 1920, [ALS] - 3. E.C.[?] to "My Dear Wolfie" 2 Jan 1921, [ALS] - 4. E.C. to "Dear Wolfie," 1 Dec 1923 [copy by Lloyd]

unittitle_ssm: Munro, Harold [The Poetry Bookshop, 35 Devonshire St., London]: Letter and Two Postcards to [ALS]
heading_ssm: Munro, Harold [The Poetry Bookshop, 35 Devonshire St., London]: Letter and Two Postcards to [ALS]

unittitle_ssm: Printed Ephemera [2 items] Contents: "Scholar Recluse 80 To-Day" Evening Standard 29 Aug 1924; Edward Carpenter International Memorial Appeal [brochure, 1932]
heading_ssm: Printed Ephemera [2 items] Contents: "Scholar Recluse 80 To-Day" Evening Standard 29 Aug 1924; Edward Carpenter International Memorial Appeal [brochure, 1932]

unittitle_ssm: Richards, Grant, 1872-1948 [9 Henrietta St., London], Three Letters and Nine Postcards to [all signed]. Contents: eleven of these [2 ltrs, 9 postcards] pertain to EC's desire to have GR publish his The Story of Eros and Psyche; the 12th item [ltr, May 10, 1901] pertains to EC's desire to have GR publish his Iolaus: an Anthology of Friendship
title_ssm: The Story of Eros and Psyche
heading_ssm: Richards, Grant, 1872-1948 [9 Henrietta St., London], Three Letters and Nine Postcards to [all signed]. Contents: eleven of these [2 ltrs, 9 postcards] pertain to EC's desire to have GR publish his The Story of Eros and Psyche; the 12th item [ltr, May 10, 1901] pertains to EC's desire to have GR publish his Iolaus: an Anthology of Friendship

unittitle_ssm: Riley, Annie, Miss: Nine Letters to [ALS] Contents: three are addressed to AR in Sheffield, England, six to AR in Massachusetts (Townsend Centre, Jamaica Plain); the last letter is addressed to Nurse A.P. Riley
heading_ssm: Riley, Annie, Miss: Nine Letters to [ALS] Contents: three are addressed to AR in Sheffield, England, six to AR in Massachusetts (Townsend Centre, Jamaica Plain); the last letter is addressed to Nurse A.P. Riley
